title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research Tutorial (Full 2025 Guide)

tactics.name: title_and_subtitle_seo
tactics.description: Prioritize keywords in title and subtitle for strongest SEO impact
source_quotes: keywords are the things that are going to drive your SEO

tactics.name: keyword_box_optimization
tactics.description: Use seven backend keyword boxes for additional visibility
source_quotes: you also have seven backend keyword boxes

tactics.name: Balance Demand & Competition
tactics.description: Prioritize keywords with high demand and low competition by analyzing opportunity scores and demand scores. Use tools like Self-Publishing Titans to identify keywords with high demand (score 9) and high opportunity (score 9).
steps: Use Self-Publishing Titans to filter keywords by demand and opportunity scores
Prioritize keywords with high demand and high opportunity scores
Use short-tail keywords for broad reach and long-tail keywords for specific targeting
caveats: Perfect high-demand/low-competition keywords are rare; balance is key
source_quotes: ideally you're looking for high demand low competition
opportunity score is probably the most important one

tactics.name: Keyword Box Strategy
tactics.description: Categorize keywords into specific phrases (first 4 boxes) and short-tail keywords (last 3 boxes) to maximize reach and rankings.
steps: Organize keywords into 7 boxes with character limits
source_quotes: the final three keyword boxes just being filled with high demand short tell keywords crammed into each box

tactics.name: Keyword Pivoting
tactics.description: Adjust keywords to balance search volume, competition, and relevance by targeting specific demographics (e.g., seniors) instead of broad terms.
caveats: Avoid misleading keywords that could result in Amazon penalties
source_quotes: 'diena coloring books for the elderly could be a great alternative because it has an opportunity score of eight'

tactics.name: Subtitle Optimization
tactics.description: Combine keyword stuffing with descriptive text to enhance search visibility and product clarity.
caveats: Avoid overstuffing; prioritize natural keyword integration
source_quotes: 'subtitles aren't just about keyword stuffing it's also good to get some descriptions in there'

heuristics.name: demand_vs_competition
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume but low competition, prioritize it
source_quotes: coloring book for seniors with dementia is a really good keyword

heuristics.name: Keyword Box Strategy
heuristics.condition: If keywords have high demand and low competition, prioritize them in the first four keyword boxes. Use short-tail keywords in the final three boxes.
source_quotes: use the first four keyword boxes with high demand and low competition keywords
final three keyword boxes just being filled with high demand short tail keywords

heuristics.name: Title Optimization Priority
heuristics.condition: If keyword is highly relevant and has high search volume/low competition, prioritize in title/subtitle
source_quotes: your best keyword should always be in your title

heuristics.name: High-Demand Low-Competition Keywords
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume and low competition, prioritize it for title/subtitle
source_quotes: 'bold and easy coloring book for seniors' is a much better option so it's seven so when you're doing keywords here you have to be very careful not to just be attracted by the metrics'

claims.statement: Keywords drive SEO and visibility on Amazon
source_quotes: keywords are the things that are going to drive your SEO

claims.statement: Niche research and keyword research are distinct processes
source_quotes: nce research is all about making sure people actually want your book

claims.statement: Combining short-tail and long-tail keywords improves visibility and targeting on Amazon.
source_quotes: it's good to have a combination of the two
short tail keywords massively increase your book's reach

claims.statement: Books with optimized titles and subtitles achieve stronger SEO rankings on Amazon KDP.
source_quotes: the best keywords are the ones are high in demand and low in competition

claims.statement: Amazon indexes keywords even when they appear in longer search phrases.
source_quotes: 'large print coloring pages or large brink coloring anytime that appears in the search term we are going to index for that'

niche_patterns.description: Combine target audience, specific need, and unique qualifier
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates highly specific search terms with lower competition
source_quotes: coloring books for seniors we basically typed in this individual keyword

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches by combining demographic identifiers with product types and unique use cases.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Increases relevance for niche audiences while leveraging keyword demand
source_quotes: large print adult coloring book for seniors with dementia
coloring books for seniors really good demand

niche_patterns.description: Combine product type with seasonal occasions and target demographics for precise keyword targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Captures specific search intent while maintaining keyword relevance
source_quotes: dinosaur activity coloring for boys gifts Christmas birthday

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with product benefits and constraints to improve keyword relevance.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines keyword demand with niche-specific needs, improving search visibility and conversion rates.
source_quotes: 'low vision could be a benefit of the book'
